q: In the long run, the sharpest weapon of all is a kind and gentle spirit.
h:
“In the long run, the sharpest weapon of all is a kind and gentle spirit.” —
Anne Frank

q: Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart.
h:
“Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: No man is happy who does not think himself so.
h:
“No man is happy who does not think himself so.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Never waste a minute of your precious life thinking about people you don't like.
h:
“Never waste a minute of your precious life thinking about people you don't like.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Most people fail in life because they major in minor things.
h:
“Most people fail in life because they major in minor things.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Judge a man by his questions rather than his answers.
h:
“Judge a man by his questions rather than his answers.” —
Voltaire

q: Either get busy living or get busy dying.
h:
“Either get busy living or get busy dying.” —
Stephen King

q: an action committed in anger is an action doomed to failure.
h:
“an action committed in anger is an action doomed to failure. ” —
Genghis Khan

q: Reversing your treatment of the man you have wronged is better than asking his forgiveness.
h:
“Reversing your treatment of the man you have wronged is better than asking his forgiveness.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: You have a brain and mind of your own. Use it, and reach your own decisions.
h:
“You have a brain and mind of your own. Use it, and reach your own decisions.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: How you think is as important as as what you think.
h:
“How you think is as important as as what you think.” —
Unknown

q: The most important thing in life is to stop saying 'I wish' and start saying 'I will'. Consider nothing impossible, then treat possibilities as probabilities.
h:
“The most important thing in life is to stop saying 'I wish' and start saying 'I will'. Consider nothing impossible, then treat possibilities as probabilities.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Inspire yourself to be great. Being good isn't good enough.
h:
“Inspire yourself to be great. Being good isn't good enough.” —
Gurbaksh Chahal

q: You're braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
h:
“You're braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.” —
A.A. Milne

q: Nothing ever goes away until it has taught us what we need to know.
h:
“Nothing ever goes away until it has taught us what we need to know.” —
Pema Chodron

q: I alone cannot change the world, but I can cast a stone across the waters to create many ripples.
h:
“I alone cannot change the world, but I can cast a stone across the waters to create many ripples.” —
Mother Teresa

q: Never to suffer would never to have been blessed.
h:
“Never to suffer would never to have been blessed.” —
Edgar Allan Poe

q: Failure is the highway to success.
h:
“Failure is the highway to success.” —
Og Mandino

q: We may not be responsible for the world that created our minds, but we can take responsibility for the mind with which we create our world.
h:
“We may not be responsible for the world that created our minds, but we can take responsibility for the mind with which we create our world.” —
Gabor Mate

q: Creativity is the greatest rebellion in existence.
h:
“Creativity is the greatest rebellion in existence.” —
Osho

q: Absence makes the heart grow fonder.
h:
“Absence makes the heart grow fonder.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Never put off to tomorrow what you can do to-day.
h:
“Never put off to tomorrow what you can do to-day.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: The greatest miracle is to be alive.
h:
“The greatest miracle is to be alive.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: Whatever you believe with feeling becomes your reality.
h:
“Whatever you believe with feeling becomes your reality. ” —
Brian Tracy

q: Inner peace is when you realize that, in the end, nothing matters.
h:
“Inner peace is when you realize that, in the end, nothing matters.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.
h:
“Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.” —
Mother Teresa

q: Everything starts with a dream. A particle of our imagination that teases us of what the future could be like, as long as we fight for it.
h:
“Everything starts with a dream. A particle of our imagination that teases us of what the future could be like, as long as we fight for it.” —
Gurbaksh Chahal

q: There is no excuse for not trying.
h:
“There is no excuse for not trying.” —
Barack Obama

q: Let my soul smile through my heart and my heart smile through my eyes, that I may scatter rich smiles in sad hearts.
h:
“Let my soul smile through my heart and my heart smile through my eyes, that I may scatter rich smiles in sad hearts. ” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: A single act of kindness throws out roots in all directions, and the roots spring up and make new trees.
h:
“A single act of kindness throws out roots in all directions, and the roots spring up and make new trees.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: A warrior does not give up what he loves, he finds the love in what he does.
h:
“A warrior does not give up what he loves, he finds the love in what he does.” —
Dan Millman

q: Your friends will know you better in the first minute you meet than your acquaintances will know you in a thousand years.
h:
“Your friends will know you better in the first minute you meet than your acquaintances will know you in a thousand years.” —
Richard Bach

q: The longer we dwell on our misfortunes, the greater is their power to harm us.
h:
“The longer we dwell on our misfortunes, the greater is their power to harm us.” —
Voltaire

q: Always show more kindness than seems necessary because the person receiving it needs it more than you will ever know.
h:
“Always show more kindness than seems necessary because the person receiving it needs it more than you will ever know.” —
Colin Powell

q: Like it or not, this moment is all we really have to work with.
h:
“Like it or not, this moment is all we really have to work with.” —
Jon Kabat-Zinn

q: We become what we believe.
h:
“We become what we believe.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: It is difficult to free fools from the chains they revere.
h:
“It is difficult to free fools from the chains they revere. ” —
Voltaire

q: Wisdom consists not so much in knowing what to do in the ultimate as knowing what to do next.
h:
“Wisdom consists not so much in knowing what to do in the ultimate as knowing what to do next.” —
Herbert Hoover

q: If you are far from the enemy, make him believe you are near.
h:
“If you are far from the enemy, make him believe you are near.” —
Sun Tzu

q: If you truly love Nature, you will find beauty everywhere.
h:
“If you truly love Nature, you will find beauty everywhere. ” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: Courage is knowing what not to fear.
h:
“Courage is knowing what not to fear.” —
Plato

q: Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much.
h:
“Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much. ” —
Oscar Wilde

q: There are two ways of seeing: with the body and with the soul. The body's sight can sometimes forget, but the soul remembers forever.
h:
“There are two ways of seeing: with the body and with the soul. The body's sight can sometimes forget, but the soul remembers forever.” —
Alexandre Dumas

q: To be able to forget means sanity.
h:
“To be able to forget means sanity.” —
Jack London

q: Nature is pleased with simplicity. And nature is no dummy.
h:
“Nature is pleased with simplicity. And nature is no dummy.” —
Isaac Newton

q: You must be willing to do what others won't do, to have what others won't have.
h:
“You must be willing to do what others won't do, to have what others won't have.” —
Les Brown

q: Dreams are the touchstones of our characters.
h:
“Dreams are the touchstones of our characters.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: Some people are old at 18 and some are young at 90. Time is a concept that humans created.
h:
“Some people are old at 18 and some are young at 90. Time is a concept that humans created.” —
Yoko Ono

q: Never buy a thing you do not want, because it is cheap, it will be dear to you.
h:
“Never buy a thing you do not want, because it is cheap, it will be dear to you.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: Allow motion to equal emotion.
h:
“Allow motion to equal emotion.” —
Elbert Hubbard
